member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.SetRowHeaderColumnWidth(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the graphical width of the specified row header column.

remarks.p: Row headers are arranged differently depending on the value of the RowHeaderLayout property.

When RowHeaderLayout is set to 'Standard', each level of each hierarchy occupies one logical column. A row axis containing (for example) three hierarchies, each with two levels results in six logical columns. In this case, specifying a value of five changes the size of the last column (the second level of the third hierarchy).

When RowHeaderLayout is set to 'Compact' or 'SuperCompact', each header column corresponds to a single hierarchy. Individual levels cannot be resized, since with the compact layouts, headers deeper than level zero are nested within the 'parent' header. To change the width of the last column of row headers, the value of the columnIndex parameter would be specified as (n - 1), where n represents the total number of hierarchies on the row axis.
Specifying a value of zero for the value parameter restores the width of the column to its default setting.

Specifying a value less than zero for either parameter causes an exception to be thrown. Specifying a value greater than the index of the last column, however, is permitted; in this case the setting takes effect when enough hierarchies are added to the row axis such that the number previously specified now represents a valid index. In the case of the 'Standard' row header layout, this may also happen when additional levels are expanded, since that action also causes the number of row header columns to increase.

Once a row header column's width is explicitly set, either programmatically or by the end user, the value persists for the lifetime of the control. To reset any given column's width, specify zero for the value parameter. To reset all column widths in one atomic operation, use the ResetAllRowHeaderColumnWidths method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.SetDataSource(Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource)
member.summary: Sets the control's DataSource property to the specified value, initializing it immediately thereafter.
member.param: The data source to assign.

remarks.p: UltraPivotGrid currently only supports data sources which derive from OlapDataSource. Attempting to assign any other value, except for null, will result in an exception being thrown.

Initialization of the newly assigned data source occurs asynchronously. After assigning a data source, a request is sent to the OLAP server for retrieval of data. When the server responds, the control will display the data that was requested.
When the DataSourceInitialized event occurs, the data can also be accessed programmatically via the Rows and Columns collections.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.RowHeaderLayout
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the manner in which row headers appear in the user interface.

remarks.p: When set to 'Standard', each hierarchy and each level therein occupy one logical column. Use this setting when real estate conservation is not a consideration.

When set to 'Compact', headers for each level n within a given hierarchy appear as children of the associated level (n - 1) header, forming a tree-like structure. Each hierarchy appears as a separate column.

When set to 'SuperCompact', headers for each level within a given hierarchy appear in one column, with each header having the same width. The content of the header, i.e., it's text and/or image, as well as the expansion indicator, is indented from the left edge of the header, with the amount of indentation directly proportional to that header's level within it's hierarchy. Use this setting to maximize usage of horizontal real estate.
Note that the RowHeaderIndentation property can be used to control indentation for the 'Compact' and 'SuperCompact' settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.RowHeaderIndentation
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the indentation for row header content when a compact layout is in effect.

remarks.p: The RowHeaderIndentation property is not applicable when the RowHeaderLayout property is set to 'Standard'
The RowHeaderIndentation property behaves differently based on the value of the RowHeaderLayout property.
When set to 'Compact', RowHeaderIndentation determines the offset between the left edge of a child header with respect to its immediate parent.
When set to 'SuperCompact', RowHeaderIndentation determines the offset between the header content (i.e., text, image, expansion indicator) and the left edge of the header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.RowHeaderAutoSizing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether row headers can be auto-sized via user interaction.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.AllowRowHeaderResize
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether horizontal resizing of the columns in which row headers appear is allowed via user interaction.

remarks.p: The number of row header columns displayed by the control is determined differently depending on the value of the RowHeaderLayout property
For the 'Standard' setting, each column corresponds to a level within a hierarchy; for the compact settings, each column corresponds to the hierarchy itself.
When row header column sizing is enabled, the user can change the width of any row header column by dragging a horizontal resizer, which appears alongside the right edge of each row header.

Row headers can also be 'auto-sized' by double-clicking this resizer. When a row header column is auto-sized, the ideal width for that header column is determined by measuring the content for each header in that column, and setting the width to be exactly large enough to fully accommodate each header's content.

The width of a row header column can be programmatically changed using the SetRowHeaderColumnWidth method. Specifying a value of zero for the value parameter clears any previously applied explicit setting, causing the column to revert to its ideal width.
All explicit row header column width settings can be cleared in one atomic operation using the ResetAllRowHeaderColumnWidths method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.PropertyCachingEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether property values assigned to PivotGridRow and PivotGridColumn instances are persisted between data source updates.

remarks.p: When an OLAP data source is updated, any data structures created by the control, i.e., rows, columns, and cells, are recreated. This causes object reference identity for previously created rows, columns, and cells to be lost, even if the new data structure is identical to the previous one.

While the PivotGridColumn and PivotGridRow classes expose settable properties which govern the appearance and behavior of the headers and cells, these property values are lost when the data source is updated, since all row and column objects are reinstantiated in this case.

The PropertyCachingEnabled property can be used to overcome this limitation, by signifying to the control that property values applied to previously created PivotGridRow and PivotGridColumn instances should be maintained between updates, and then reapplied to the corresponding objects after the update is completed.

It should be noted that in the case where the data structure contains a relatively large number of rows and/or columns, performance can be adversely affected by enabling property caching, since a dictionary lookup is required to identify a row/column, and also because the property values of the previous object must be serialized, and then deserialized and applied to the new instance.
Use the ClearPropertyCache method to dereference all previously cached instances, thus releasing any memory used for that purpose.
Note that when the value of this property transitions from true to false, any existing cached values are dereferenced, as if the ClearPropertyCache method were called directly.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.FormatProvider
member.summary: Returns or sets the format provider for this control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.UseServerFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether a cell should display the value returned from its FormattedValue property.

remarks.p: By default, cells display values as formatted by the OLAP server. This improves overall performance by eliminating the need for the client to convert the raw value to a string.

Set this property to false to enable control over the formatting of cell values. When UseServerFormat is set to false, the column's Format and FormatProvider properties are used to format the cell's value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGrid.SortedColumns
member.summary: Returns a collection which contains each column on which a sort direction has been specified.

remarks.p: The SortedColumns collection can be used to determine which columns have a sort direction defined, and can also be used to actually change the sort direction of one or more columns.

To sort the rows in the pivot grid based on the cell values of a particular column, use the collection's Add method. Because sorting on multiple columns is supported, the method includes a parameter which enables the developer to specify whether to clear or extend the existing sort.
A column's sort direction can also be changed via the column's SortDirection property. When this value is changed, the SortedColumns collection is automatically updated to reflect the change.

The control's ColumnSorting is raised prior to the application of the new sort criteria; this event can be canceled to prevent the sort criteria from changing. The ColumnSorted event is raised immediately after the new sort criteria is applied.

member.summary: Returns a reference to the UltraPivotGrid associated with this item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.AllowResize
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether this column can be resized via the user interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.AutoSizing
member.summary: Returns or sets a flagged value indicating the manner in which this column's width is adjusted when the column is auto-sized.

remarks.p: Note that the value of this property is not applicable when column sizing is disabled altogether (see AllowResize).

By default, the string representation of each cell's value is considered when determining the ideal width. In scenarios where there are a relatively large number of rows, this can impact performance adversely.
This performance hit can be avoided by omitting the 'AllCells' flag from this setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.Format
member.summary: Returns the format string used to format the value displayed by the cells associated with this column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.FormatProvider
member.summary: Returns the IFormatProvider implementation which controls formatting for the cells associated with this column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.SortDirection
member.summary: Returns a value which indicates whether this column is sorted and if so, the sort direction.

remarks.p: A return value of null indicates that the column is not sorted.
Use the Sort method to change the sort direction for this column.
Alternatively, the SortedColumns collection can be used to change the sort direction for this column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.HeaderClickAction
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the action that is taken when a ColumnHeaderUIElement is clicked or tapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.SortIndicatorVisibility
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether a SortIndicatorUIElement is displayed on this column's header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.UseServerFormat
member.summary: Returns the format string used to format the value displayed by the cells associated with this column.

remarks.p: By default, cells display values as formatted by the OLAP server. This improves overall performance by eliminating the need for the client to convert the raw value to a string.
Set this property to false to enable control over the formatting of cell values. When UseServerFormat is set to false, the Format and FormatProvider properties are used to format the cell values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Data.PivotGridColumn.Width
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of this column.

remarks.p: Set the value of this property to zero to use the calculated ideal width.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridStates.UpdatingDataSource
member.summary: A request for data has been sent to the OLAP server, but the server has not yet answered the request.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridStates.ActiveCell

member.summary: The currently active cell belongs to the first column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridStates.ActiveCellInLastColumn
member.summary: The currently active cell belongs to the last column.

member.summary: The currently active cell is on the first row in the grid.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridStates.ActiveCellOnLastRow
member.summary: The currently active cell is on the last row in the grid.

member.summary: The currently active cell can be selected/deselected.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellHotTrackingBehavior
member.summary: Exposes constants which define the hot tracking behavior for a PivotGridCell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellHotTrackingBehavior.None
member.summary: Cells do not exhibit any hot tracking visual effect.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellHotTrackingBehavior.OneCell
member.summary: Only the cell over which the cursor is currently positioned exhibits a hot tracking visual effect.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellHotTrackingBehavior.AllCells
member.summary: All cells associated with this row/column exhibit a hot tracking visual effect when the cursor is positioned over any cell associated with the item.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates
member.summary: Flagged enumeration which exposes a constant for each possible user interface state available to a PivotGridCell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.Normal
member.summary: Normal state.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.HotTrackingDirect
member.summary: The cursor is positioned within the cell's bounds.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.HotTrackingIndirect
member.summary: The cursor is not positioned within the bounds of this cell, but is considered to be hot tracking by virtue of the value of the CellHotTrackingBehavior property for the row or column associated with the cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.Active
member.summary: The cell is active.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.Selected
member.summary: The cell is selected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellStates.Updating
member.summary: A request for data has been sent to the OLAP server, but a response has not yet been received. This state indicates that the associated user interface element is not active.

member.summary: A request for data has been sent to the OLAP server, but a response has not yet been received. This state indicates that the associated user interface element is not active.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection
member.summary: Constants which determine whether concurrent selection of disparate items (i.e., rows, columns, and cells) is allowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.None
member.summary: Selection of rows, columns, and cells is mutually exclusive, i.e., if an item of one type is currently selected, selection is disallowed for items of the other types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.Rows
member.summary: Selection of rows in conjunction with items of different types is allowed. For example, if a cell is currently selected, and the user attempts to extend the selection to include a row, the operation is allowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.Columns
member.summary: Selection of columns in conjunction with items of different types is allowed. For example, if a row is currently selected, and the user attempts to extend the selection to include a column, the operation is allowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.Cells
member.summary: Selection of cells in conjunction with items of different types is allowed. For example, if a row is currently selected, and the user attempts to extend the selection to include a single cell, the operation is allowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.RowsAndColumns
member.summary: Combines the 'Rows' and 'Columns' settings. Rows and columns can exist concurrently within the same selection, but cells cannot.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.RowsAndCells
member.summary: Combines the 'Rows' and 'Cells' settings. Rows and cells can exist concurrently within the same selection, but columns cannot.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.ColumnsAndCells
member.summary: Combines the 'Columns' and 'Cells' settings. Columns and cells can exist concurrently within the same selection, but rows cannot.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowDisparateSelection.All
member.summary: Combines the 'Rows', 'Columns', and 'Cells' settings. Items of any type can exist concurrently within the same selection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowSelection
member.summary: Constants which determine whether selection is allowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowSelection.None
member.summary: Selection is disallowed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowSelection.Single
member.summary: Only one item may be selected at any given time.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.AllowSelection.Extended
member.summary: Any number of items may be selected at any given time.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.SortIndicatorVisibility
member.summary: Constants which determine whether a column's sort indicator is visible in the user interface.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.SortIndicatorVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The sort indicator is always visible. An indeterminate indicator is displayed when the column's SortDirection property has not been explicitly set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.SortIndicatorVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: The sort indicator is never visible. The column's SortDirection property can only be changed by the developer.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.SortIndicatorVisibility.VisibleWhenSorted
member.summary: The sort indicator is visible only when the column's SortDirection property has been explicitly set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.SortIndicatorVisibility.MouseOverWhenNotSorted
member.summary: Similar to the 'VisibleWhenSorted' setting, but also displays an indeterminate indicator when the column is not explicitly sorted and the cursor is positioned within the bounds of the header which contains the indicator. This setting makes it possible for the user to change the sort direction, while at the same time not displaying the indeterminate indicator unless the user positions the cursor over it.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction
member.summary: Constants which determine the action taken when a cell is clicked or tapped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction.Activate
member.summary: The cell is activated, i.e., becomes the new ActiveCell. The cell is not selected, nor is the associated row or column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction.SelectCell
member.summary: The cell is selected, i.e., added to the Selection's Cells collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction.SelectColumn
member.summary: The cell's column is selected, i.e., added to the Selection's Columns collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.CellClickAction.SelectRow
member.summary: The cell's row is selected, i.e., added to the Selection's Rows collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnHeaderClickAction
member.summary: Constants which determine the action taken when a column header is clicked or tapped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnHeaderClickAction.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnHeaderClickAction.Select
member.summary: The column is selected, i.e., added to the Selection's Columns collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnHeaderClickAction.Sort
member.summary: The column is sorted, i.e., the same action is performed as when the SortIndicatorUIElement is clicked.

member.summary: Constants which define the user actions available through keyboard mappings.

member.summary: The first cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateFirstCellOnRow

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateLastCell
member.summary: The last cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateLastCellOnRow
member.summary: The last cell in the row containing the currently active cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellLeft
member.summary: The cell to the left of the currently active cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well. Any previously selected rows, columns, and cells are deselected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellLeftNoSelect
member.summary: The cell to the left of the currently active cell is activated; selection is not affected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellRight
member.summary: The cell to the right of the currently active cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well. Any previously selected rows, columns, and cells are deselected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellRightNoSelect
member.summary: The cell to the right of the currently active cell is activated; selection is not affected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellUp
member.summary: The cell above the currently active cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well. Any previously selected rows, columns, and cells are deselected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellUpNoSelect
member.summary: The cell above the currently active cell is activated; selection is not affected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellDown
member.summary: The cell below the currently active cell is activated and, if it is selectable, selected as well. Any previously selected rows, columns, and cells are deselected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ActivateCellDownNoSelect
member.summary: The cell below the currently active cell is activated; selection is not affected.

member.summary: The selected state of the currently active cell is inverted (a.k.a., toggled); any previously selected rows, columns, or cells are deselected

member.summary: The selected state of the currently active cell is inverted (a.k.a., toggled); the previous selection is unchanged

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ExtendCellSelectionLeft
member.summary: The cell to the left of the currently active cell is activated, and the cell selection is extended to include this cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ExtendCellSelectionRight
member.summary: The cell to the right of the currently active cell is activated, and the cell selection is extended to include this cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ExtendCellSelectionUp
member.summary: The cell above the currently active cell is activated, and the cell selection is extended to include this cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.ExtendCellSelectionDown

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.CloseFilterSelectorDiscardChanges
member.summary: The filter selector is closed as if the user clicked the Cancel button.

member.summary: The control is scrolled one logical page upward.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.UltraPivotGridAction.PageDown

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnAutoSizeFlags
member.summary: Flagged enumeration which contains a constant for each of the criteria that determines the ideal size for a

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnAutoSizeFlags.None
member.summary: The width of the column is not changed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnAutoSizeFlags.Header
member.summary: The width of the column is calculated based on the width required to fully display the header text, as well as additional elements such as an image and sort indicator.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnAutoSizeFlags.AllCells
member.summary: The string representation of each cell's value is measured, and the width of the column is set to accommodate the largest value. If the cell has an image, the width at which the image is displayed is also included.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.ColumnAutoSizeFlags.HeaderAndCells
member.summary: Combines the 'Header' and 'AllCells' flags; the column's width is made large enough to accommodate the ideal width of the header or the width of the largest cell value, using the larger of those two values.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DataSourceUpdatingEffects
member.summary: Flagged enumeration which contains a constant for each of the visual effects available to depict the 'updating' state.

remarks.p: When the control is awaiting a response from the OLAP server, the user interface is essentially locked.
The control exposes numerous appearance properties which are applied when the control is in this state, and also displays a busy state indicator.
These flags provide a way for the developer to customize the appearance of the control when it is in the busy state.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DataSourceUpdatingEffects.None
member.summary: No visual effects are applied.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DataSourceUpdatingEffects.Appearances
member.summary: The appearance for the 'Updating' state is applied to each element for which such an appearance is defined. Clear this flag to disable the application of these appearances.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DataSourceUpdatingEffects.ShowIndicator
member.summary: A circular busy state indicator is displayed; clearing this flag removes the indicator.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DataSourceUpdatingEffects.AppearancesAndIndicator
member.summary: Combines the 'Appearances' and 'ShowIndicator' flags; appearances are applied and the busy state indicator is displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.RowHeaderLayout.Compact

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.RowHeaderLayout.SuperCompact

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.RowHeaderSizing.Horizontal

member.summary: Constants which determine whether row headers can be automatically sized via user interaction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.RowHeaderAutoSizing.Horizontal
member.summary: The width of the column in which the row header appears is calculated based on the width required to fully display the content for each header in that column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.DropAreaDragOverEventArgs.DisallowDrop
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the drag/drop operation should be explicitly disallowed.

remarks.p: Use this property to cancel the drag/drop operation that is currently in progress.
Because the dragged data may be incompatible with the drop location, a drag/drop operation cannot be explicitly allowed; as such, setting this property to false has no effect.
When this property is set to true, the DropAreaDragDrop event does not occur.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinPivotGrid.Selection
member.summary: Class which exposes methods through which rows, columns, and cells can be selected.

remarks.p: UltraPivotGrid supports concurrent selection of any combination of rows, columns, and cells.
Note that selection is not maintained between changes in the data source, i.e., any action that causes the data source to be updated also causes the current selection to be cleared.
Also note that all selections are cleared when a column is sorted.
